boardgame.name: Tipsy Trips #2: A Talented Tree
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wood you believe it?!

Give your PCs dendrophobia in A Talented Tree, the new adventure from Tipsy Tabby Publishing!

Almost a century ago, a druid with evil in his heart died, and a sapling planted on his grave. It was slowly imbued with his dark magics. The other trees died out, but the cursed tree remained...and awakened.

In awakening, it came to develop an intellect with psychic powers and a madness born from lack of contact with other sentient beings. Eventually, the tree's form took on a twisted look, and a mage tried to detect magic on it. That mage's mind was struck by the tree through their magical connection, and she became its puppet.

With the mage's body and the tree's psychic power, the nearby village of Tenneson was overwhelmed and made into similar mind-slaves, using the mage's power with its own to do it all.

Enter our heroes – who just might be struck down by...A Talented Tree?

An adventure for Pathfinder 1st Edition, designed for four 4th-level player characters.

boardgame.name: The Craftsman
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mixed nuts, and bolts!

We all want an artificer class for Pathfinder. But if the Alchemist doesn't quite cut it for you, say hello to the Craftsman from Tipsy Tabby Publishing!

By creating a Defender, a golem after a sort that shields him from enemies, this class has plenty to work on in his spare time, and he has the tools to do so!

Spending time and effort on the Defender can give the Craftsman plenty of options in a fight, but that's hardly his limit; he can also spend time creating magic items, and is naturally gifted with the Craft skill!

Roll up your sleeves, grab the screwdriver, saw, hammer, and fasteners – it's time to get your hands dirty as the Craftsman!

boardgame.name: NEXT-Level Toxicology
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bottle fame, brew glory, and even stopper death!

Are you disappointed in 5e poisons? Well, look no further: Tipsy Tabby Publishing is here with NEXT-Level Toxicology!

The system contained within is used to develop better herbal poisons, and also modifies the venoms in the Monster Manual for extra effect! Poison damage becomes more of a fearful weapon herein!

An enterprising poisoner finds rules for making poisons with the poisoner's kit, as well as making them better, and even going into developing your own!

Choke the local lord on his own food with NEXT-Level Toxicology!

boardgame.name: The World Game: Board Game
boardgame.description:
Race around the world, pass famous landmarks, learn about countries, recognize flags and find locations on the map. Spend quality time with your family and friends.

Answer questions like:
Can you recognize the flag of Chile?
What is the capital of India?
Can you show Sweden on the map?

Steal cards with a pirate attack, send players back with a tsunami, freeze them with a snow storm and so much more! Packed with action, knowledge and endless fun!

GAMEPLAY:

The game's objective is to be the first player to finish the race around the world and cross the finish line. You move forward by winning with strong country facts or by answering geography challenges correctly.

Every turn each player draws a card from the country card pile. When it’s your turn, roll one dice. Then you have to choose between 2 options. Calling out a fact or a challenge.

FACT
Pick a fact you believe is the strongest one and try to beat other players. But be careful, if you lose someone else will move forward.

CHALLENGE
Yell challenge! The player to your left will challenge you with recognizing the flag, or finding a country on the map. If you decide on the hard challenge, you can even guess the capital city of a country. If you are playing with kids, they can guess the continent of a country. If you answer wrong, the next player gets a chance. If everyone answers wrong, the challenger moves forward.

boardgame.name: Whispers: Spring-Heeled Jack
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Naughty children are told stories of a hopping devil that will spirit them away for misdeeds, pranks, and shenanigans. If they aren’t good little boys and girls this springing devil will find them, scare them near to death, and if they are especially wicked take them away.

Spring-Heeled Jack, so named for their vaunted jumping ability, first came to the attention of the public in the mid-1830s. Soon stories of their troublemaking ways would spread throughout the British Isles and beyond turning up in urban settings throughout the world.

Spring-Heeled Jack explores the legend of Jack, giving the GM everything they need to insert them into their Whispers in the Dark campaign:

The legend of Spring-Heeled Jack
Two Statblocks - Gentleman Jack and The Devil Jack
Handout for your players
Scenario Hooks
Using Spring-Heeled Jack in your campaign

boardgame.name: The Trick or Treat Gang
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Misfits & Menaces the Trick or Treat Gang provides a group of unlikely super-villains from an alternate dimension where every day is Halloween. Includes details on the Gang's alternate dimension, racial stats to make your own characters of the same species as the presented gang member races, and a range of caper ideas.

Gang members include:

Bad Vlad is an exiled baron vampire who gets squeamish at the sight of blood.
Pumpkin Eater is the Trick or Treat Gang's leader and a prince in exile. An army of minions, the pumpkin heads, are his to command -- once he eats and regurgitates their pumpkin innards.
Raggedy is a dark priestess of the Ragdoo religion. She wields forbidden magic and Ragdoo dolls against her enemies.
Skelestan is the Gang's streetfighting muscle despite being a living skeleton without a bit of flesh on his bones.
Winnie Witch is a broom-riding witch with a chip on her shoulder.

boardgame.name: A Cold and Resolute Fight: The Battle for Narvik, April-June, 1940
boardgame.description:
The German invasion of Demark and Norway, Operation Weserűbung, was a bold gamble by the invaders. The greatest risk for the Germans was at the northern most all weather port of Narvik. Here the Germans landed troops that quickly overwhelmed the local Norwegian garrison but left them entirely dependent upon supplies and reinforcements that would arrive by ship or air transport. The Allies recognized the German’s vulnerability and sent the Royal Navy into the Narvik fjord where their warships quickly sank all of the German vessels. With winter weather persisting, air transport would never be able to provide sufficient levels of men and material to sustain the now trapped German invaders. The Allies sent a mixed nationality force of British, French and Poles to support the Norwegian defense forces that were laying siege to the Germans. What resulted was an epic contest that threatened to unravel the Nazi blitzkrieg. Perhaps you can do as well or better?

Each copy of A Cold and Resolute Fight is composed of the following:

• Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets
• One sheet of 120 double-sided counters
• This set of rules.

Players will also need a standard deck of cards, one six-sided die (D6) and an opaque container (mug, envelope or anything similar) to play the game.

Most units are battalions of 700 to 800 men and their equipment (German KG are slightly smaller). Tank units represent 6-10 vehicles. A turn represents one week of time and a hex is slightly more than 2.5 miles across.

A Cold and Resolute Fight is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Nils Johansson.

-description from designer

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of A Cold and Resolute Fight by the designer and publisher.
Mounted counters can be had for an additional $8.00.
The Cold and Resolute card set is an additional $10.00. The card set replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the game's rules, features graphics by the same artist that did the game's, and has rules reminders on pertinent cards.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: Shogun (1987/Famicom)
boardgame.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Shogun (将軍) is a simulation game developed by Nippon Dexter and published for the MSX in 1987. It was later ported to the Famicom by Hector in 1988. It is a simulation game about living the life of a Shogun in feudal Japan.

boardgame.name: Brúnó Budapesten Dunafutam
boardgame.description:
Brúnó visits his parents at the Budapest Zoo, and then they go by car to the Kopaszi Dam, where they also run into the Orsi family. Players also have to go along the road, through the bridges of Budapest. Who will reach the finish line soonest? The journey may be long, but it’s no wonder there are plenty to see. Little travelers have to roll the dice first, then follow the instructions on the given field and move towards the goal!

The rules are simple and easy to follow and you can play a game in an average of 15-20 minutes.

The drawings of Erika Bartos acquaint the children with the famous buildings, public spaces and bridges of Budapest in a simplified, yet perfectly recognizable way.

After the highly successful Brúnó board game collection in Budapest, now the Danube and its bridges have taken the lead.

Board games can be easily and wonderfully linked to Brúnó Budapest books. Playing to get acquainted with the image and sights of the capital as a young child.

boardgame.name: King Kong 2: Ikari no Megaton Punch
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_Kong_2%3A_Ikari_no_Megaton_Punch King Kong 2: Ikari no Megaton Punch]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

King Kong 2: Ikari no Megaton Punch (キングコング2 怒りのメガトンパンチ, Kingu Kongu Tsū: Ikari no Megaton Panchi, lit. "King Kong 2: The Furious Megaton Punch") is a 1986 Family Computer action adventure game by Konami. It was released only in Japan and based on the movie of the same year, King Kong Lives (King Kong 2 being the film's title in Japan).

boardgame.name: Hi no Tori Hououhen: Gaou no Bouken
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hi_no_Tori_Hououhen%3A_Gaou_no_Bouken Hi no Tori Hououhen: Gaou no Bouken]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Hi no Tori Hououhen: Gaou no Bouken (火の鳥 鳳ほう凰おう編へん 我ガ王おうの冒ぼう険けん, "Phoenix Chronicles: Gaou's Adventure") is a 1987 video game for the Famicom developed by Konami, produced alongside a similarly named game for the MSX. Both games are based on the manga series Phoenix created by renowned Japanese manga artist Osamu Tezuka.

boardgame.name: Ninja Hattori-kun
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ninja_Hattori-kun_%28video_game%29 Ninja Hattori-kun (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Ninja Hattori-kun (忍者ハットリくん, lit. "Little Ninja Hattori") is a 1986 video game software developed and published by Hudson Soft exclusively in Japan for the Nintendo Family Computer . It is based on Fujiko Fujio A's (pen name of Motoo Abiko) Japanese manga series of the same name, which later became an anime series and Asian franchise. The game was released around the same time the anime was aired. It was the fifth best selling Famicom game released in 1986, selling approximately 1,500,000 copies in its lifetime

boardgame.name: Raid on the Decadent Spires
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

High above the city skyline, in towers that seem to sadistically pierce the sky, the Nobles dwell in arrogant splendor. Such wealth attracts both the enterprising and the desperate, but both must contend with the dangers the spires pose to mortals...

Raid on the Decadent Spires is a stealth, tower-crawling adventure for the world’s most popular role-playing game. It can be popped into almost any fantasy setting and provides a high-risk, high-reward place to explore and exploit.

Inside the zine you will find:

A system for sneaking and causing alarm within the Spires.
A way to quickly and easily generate a cluster of towers.
Opulent locations with their own treasures and quirks.
Decadent and dangerous monsters including THE NOBLE: a once arrogant ruler made demigod through wealth and hedonism.


Survive your raid on the spires and you will be rich as sin.

Fail and you will be trapped within its walls forever...

boardgame.name: The Forbidden Isle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A renown rogue has stolen an heirloom from a powerful family and fled to a little-visited island. There he waits for news from those who have offered to fence the item. A party of adventurers is being sought to both hunt the criminal down before he can escape the island, and return the treasure to its rightful owners. Unfortunately, there are complications.

The Forbidden Isle is surrounded by foreboding magic, has some very strange geography, and is inhabited by dangerous creatures including the mysterious humanoids known as Icylanders. A final concern is that more than one group may be competing to win the bounty being offered! Can the adventurers beat the clock and their opponents?

Are you a game master looking for an interesting and challenging adventure for your players? Then consider The Borbidden Isle, designed for a band of 5-8 5th Edition DnD characters of 4th to 6th level.

The module includes maps of the island and significant structures, stat blocks for all NPCs and opponents, and a new class, the Sigil Alchemist. A set of pre-generated player characters, and a ready-to-print, poster-sized version of the cover are included as seperate PDF files.

boardgame.name: Takahashi Meijin no Bug-tte Honey
boardgame.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Takahashi Meijin no Bug-tte Honey (or Takahashi Meijin's Bug-tte Honey) is an action game developed by Hudson Soft for the Famicom in 1987. It is based upon an anime of the same name, which features a cast of characters that includes Takahashi Meijin, the main character and hero of the Adventure Island series, as well as redesign of the honeygirl fairy known as Bug-tte Honey (pronounced Bugute). Fan dubs call her Honey Bee. In the anime, Takahashi and Honey get into various adventures along with three ordinary school children from Earth. Many of the episodes reference other popular Hudson Famicom titles such as Bomberman and Lode Runner.

boardgame.name: Pensilly
boardgame.description:
Have you ever tried to draw on a rumbling train or draw a maze puzzle on a spin washing machine? No??? No wonder, since drawing in calm conditions on a secure basis may be best. And then comes this rounded giant pencil that keeps squirming, vibrating. With this, try to put together a normal figure. It’s very funny when you can’t draw a simple picture like an apple because of the constant squirming-twitching of your drawing tool. And then we didn’t even talk about the more complicated images. We tried and laughed a lot. A real good party game for kids, but also a good party for adults.
Adult companies can also undertake to draw more complex diagrams. The set includes 2 felt-tip pens, which can be replaced with tools of the same size. It can be played as a team game, like activity.

boardgame.name: Movie Plotz: Bonus Features
boardgame.description:
An expansion game (bonus cards) that is played after you create the movie.

These cards are shuffled and one is taken randomly, or in competitive play - the first person voted thumbs down gets to take their pick.

After the film is complete, each player gets their chance to add their version of the bonus features. There will be lots of callbacks to the movie, and in some cases, a little revenge by the players that were down voted by their screenwriting peers.

boardgame.name: Movie Plotz: Behind the Scenes
boardgame.description:
In a world... where players make their own movies, using just 12 cards and their wild imaginations. Starring [insert actor here] and written by [insert your name here], the games you play will leave you laughing, crying, and forever changed. It's time to make some movies!

A book featuring 20+ ways to play the game. Some great team building and competitive variants in there.

Alex has been hard at work making LOTS of variations on Movie Plotz. There's a 2 player "Gotcha Game" where players must force cards on their opponent, a team "Combo Pitch" where teams huddle up and hone their pitch before presenting it in a head-to-head battle of scripts, a "Classroom Edition" where a student starts the movie and passes it on, and many more.

boardgame.name: The Stalking Terror
boardgame.description:
It was supposed to be a fun day at the haunted corn maze. However, little did you know the corn maze was actually haunted. Not only that, but a strange small town cult who worships the corn is trying to summon a demon scarecrow from the netherworld--and they have plans to sacrifice you. Now, separated from your friends, can you escape the maze?

The Stalking Terror is a single page Roll + Write RPG using the Delve12 system.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Red Dust Rebellion
boardgame.description:
“200 years of Earth rule. 200 years of being told what to do by people on some distant blue orb in the sky. A pampered planet populated by soft people. Earth politicians playing golf on a sunny day, while sipping French champagne and eating grapes, dare to tell us how to live? They don’t know us, because they are not us! We are the sons and daughters of Mars! The children of the red planet! We were born in the red dust and we say no more to Earther rule!”
Aroha Thompson, Red Dust spokesperson and Mining Union organizer.

It is 2250 and the bicentennial celebrations of the first human colony on Mars are about to begin. 200 years of human achievement, but also 200 years of hardship. Mars is an unforgiving world, a barren wasteland on the surface, therefore the people live in vast underground cities known as labyrinths.
Over the years, the people of Mars have formed their own culture and identity and want more say in their own rule. To many, Earth is a remote world with too much control over Martian affairs. Furthermore, Earth’s corporations have too much power over life and death. Some long for a green Mars, covered in oceans and life. While others recoil at the idea that humanity will destroy the climate of another planet.
Red Dust Rebellion is volume XIII of GMT's acclaimed COIN Series, and tells the story of the Martian revolts of the 2250’s and the rise of Martian nationalism.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Rot, Pox, and Worm (AtDM)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

TheDarkmaster toils endlessly to bring ruin to the world, crafting more horrific plagues, infections, and creatures along the way. The brutality of the world works ever harder to force nature into the endless arms race of survival, and disease is no different. Civilization forces the people of the world into ever more crowded and unsanitary conditions in the name of progress and safety in numbers.

These two-dozen new diseases are mere examples of the infinite festering conditions simmering in the pot of corrupted nature. They are designed to run the gamut of sicknesses and mechanical impacts on characters to enrich the struggles and triumphs of you characters, ranging from inconvenient, to dangerous, to outright deadly.

boardgame.name: Wolfsbane Hollow (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shielded to the north by the Vurdfell Spine’s lofty peaks and protected from the Hordelands of the east by the Greatshadow Gorge, the town of Wolfsbane Hollow has persisted in relative isolation for hundreds of years. Seemingly a simple border town, a dark shadow hangs over this hard, rough settlement. For here, the rule of law is tenuous at best, and the mayor is but a figurehead. The true power of Wolfsbane Hollow is the shadowy thieves’ guild and their monstrous, bestial guildmaster who lurks in his lair carved from the fallen, mouldering bones of an ancient empire.

boardgame.name: Wolfsbane Hollow (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shielded to the north by the Vurdfell Spine’s lofty peaks and protected from the Hordelands of the east by the Greatshadow Gorge, the town of Wolfsbane Hollow has persisted in relative isolation for hundreds of years. Seemingly a simple border town, a dark shadow hangs over this hard, rough settlement. For here, the rule of law is tenuous at best, and the mayor is but a figurehead. The true power of Wolfsbane Hollow is the shadowy thieves’ guild and their monstrous, bestial guildmaster who lurks in his lair carved from the fallen, mouldering bones of an ancient empire.

boardgame.name: Wolfsbane Hollow (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shielded to the north by the Vurdfell Spine’s lofty peaks and protected from the Hordelands of the east by the Greatshadow Gorge, the town of Wolfsbane Hollow has persisted in relative isolation for hundreds of years. Seemingly a simple border town, a dark shadow hangs over this hard, rough settlement. For here, the rule of law is tenuous at best, and the mayor is but a figurehead. The true power of Wolfsbane Hollow is the shadowy thieves’ guild and their monstrous, bestial guildmaster who lurks in his lair carved from the fallen, mouldering bones of an ancient empire.

boardgame.name: Unwelcome Guests
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unwelcome Guests introduces new parasites for use in your Shadow of the Demon Lord games. The most obvious use of the material contained in this supplement is to infest the player characters with a delightful assortment of disgusting ailments, but you can also use these parasites as weaknesses for foes, hooks for adventures you create, or as set dressing for the places your groups explore.

boardgame.name: Tag Team: Cobras Expansion
Tag Team: Commerce Road Cobra Khans
boardgame.description:
This is a full extra crew that you can swap in or out of your games (or play with an extra player). You can also mix and match crews to make a custom one. It includes one set of 7 Cobras and 1 Reference Card.

These days it's not enough to be the toughest crew on the streets; you need to make sure everyone knows it, too. Bring enough cans of spray paint to tag walls all over town, and enough muscle to make sure no one else does. There's nothing quite as satisfying as watching little punks drop their spray cans and run at the very sight of you — just make sure that there isn't someone even bigger right around the corner!

In Tag Team, you play as a crew of Eagles, Bulldogs, Alligators or Gorillas, defending your turf by bluffing your way through battles each day. Players simultaneously reveal their leader characters, and, if nobody backs down, their backup characters join the fight. The winner tags their opponent's territory as a reward. In the end, the crew with the most tagged territory wins.

Each version of Tag Team is fully playable and includes two characters. With both versions (and the small Cobras expansion), you can mix and match characters.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tag Team: Uptown Jailbirds vs. Downtown Bullies
Tag Team: Woodland Park Guerrillas vs. Back Alley Gators

boardgame.name: The Golem Maker's Workshop
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The hiss of steam and the constant hammering of machinery.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting an urban workshop for the Golem Maker, powered by a waterwheel and other machinery.

boardgame.name: The Buried Temple of Gun'Kurta
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lost beneath a huge sand-dune for centuries, a recent sandstorm has revealed the long-forgotten ruins.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a buried temple in a desert setting.

boardgame.name: The Cartographers' Guildhall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The place to go when you need a map!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

boardgame.name: General Armington's Field HQ
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We need a decision, General... now!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a military field HQ during the midst of an urban battle or siege. The Cartographers' Guildhall has been taken over and turned into a field headquarters.

boardgame.name: Penbleak Prison
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The corridors echo with the sound of iron bars clanging shut

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting an urban prison / jail. High walls, cells, canteen areas, guard rooms and an infirmary. Perfect for break-outs!

boardgame.name: Eyno Bleside Colony Market
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A thriving market in space junk!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x30 map depicting a futuristic sci-fi market on a desert planet. Includes generic version without market stalls. Also includes interiors for some of the buildings. Would work well for Mos Eisley on Tatooine.

boardgame.name: Dobbeltime
boardgame.description:
Dobbeltime is a dice game, which is about speed and reaction time.

Each player has a scorecard with numbers from 1-12 in green, black, blue, yellow and red. The goal is to be the first player to make a vertical, horizontal and diagonal row of five numbers.

The active player rolls all the six dices (1 white, 1 black, 1 red, 1 green, 1 blue and 1 yellow). At the moment the dices are on the table, every player can find a number by adding the value on the white dice and the value of one of the coloured (except white) dices. The active player also has the possibility to find a number with only one of the coloured. When a player finds a number, the player needs to put a hand on the base and needs to say the number and the color. If the player is right, he can put a cross on the number. If the player is wrong the player should put a cross in the wrong area.

The first player with a row of five numbers, wins the game

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Godwit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Contents: A 20x30 map depicting a spacecraft, with living areas, control rooms, and upper-level bridge. Depicted with choice of backgrounds (hangar, space, white)

boardgame.name: Riverside Warehouse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A busy riverside warehouse? Seems legit... Not so much at night though..

Riverside Warehouse is a set of printable battemaps compatible with any RPG game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Riverside Warehouse is a day & night set, comprising of 2 20x30 battlemaps. They feature a large warehouse beside a canal or river (or sea), and is filled with crates, boxes and barrels. Admin and office rooms are provided.

boardgame.name: The Crypts of the Aimascurs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hex 15.43 -- the Crypt of the Aimascurs, is a hex in the Rawhide Gang cluster of hexes. It features a hill giant camp, a greater medusa with oracular powers, and the eponymous crypt, populated with a variety of mummies. Includes rules for making mummies more interesting.

boardgame.name: Anthelion: Conclave of Power – Deluxe Playmat
boardgame.description: One huge 14" x 24" Anthelion Playmat.

boardgame.name: Pentaquark: Playmat
boardgame.description: A 12" x 18" playmat for Pentaquark.

boardgame.name: Phantom Earth War vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A star demon lord has arrived on the Phantom Earth and has begun a war on the galaxy. Who will bring an end to his evil reign?

Phantom Earth War vol. 1 provides all the information needed about the Phantom Earth and Lord ShadArk and his demons.

This module includes:

Stats for all the core demons and human collaborators

Information on the Lord ShadArk’s temple with map

Information on key locations

boardgame.name: Servants of the Pristine Illumination
boardgame.description:
Welcome, Servants of the Pristine Illumination!

As a devotee, you are charged with the responsibility of maintaining the alignment of world events in accordance with the directions of the Grand Pristine – the prestigious and esteemed leader of the Order. Similar to other Servants, you have been gifted with the ability to travel from one timeline to another; timeline branches occur every 30 years (1960, 1990, 2020, and 2050).

You have been given an assignment emphasised as having particular importance to the Grand Pristine, however it has not been indicated why this is the case. Eager to please, you have accepted the assignment and are preparing to depart.

boardgame.name: Rainbow Pirates
boardgame.description:
Rainbow Pirates is kind of like playing Rummy on an enchanted island while being attacked by pirates drinking piña coladas.

The object of the game is to earn as many Treasure Points as possible by placing card groups (treasure) on your island. However, you can also attack your opponents with pirate cards (stealing or blowing up their treasure) or use them to give yourself other advantages.

The game was designed to allow for multiple strategies (ranging from guns-blazing aggressive to peace-loving non-violence) based on the player's hand, preferences, and group dynamics. (eg, attacking an opponent's island can give you the edge you need to win, but also often causes reprisals and limits the treasure you earn from Black Cards)

Game actions during your turn include: placing cards (for Treasure Points), rearranging cards (to and from your island and hand), and playing pirate cards (to attack opponents or give yourself advantages).

When it is not your turn, you have the opportunity to BLOCK incoming pirate attacks if you have the right matching Color Card in your hand. (Eg, the Captain Card can be stopped by bribing him with a green "Me Time" Color Card) This will stop the attack, but you lose the ability to earn Treasure Points from the card used as a bribe.

A game can end in 2 possible ways:
1) When a player goes out (by playing all cards from their hand AND having at least 2 full rainbows on their island)
2) Running out of draw cards

Going out does NOT necessarily mean you win, but you do earn a BONUS 5 Treasure Points which often is enough to give you the win.

Rainbow Pirate cards are rare in the deck and highly valuable (worth 5 Treasure Points each). They often become the focus of pirate attacks and thievery between players. While valuable, these cards can also become a distraction, tempting players to drain too many resources to obtain them. This game dynamic can result in interesting gameplay and strategies, especially when playing with 3 or more players.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Katakomben
boardgame.description:
Warcry: Catacombs is a stunning new core set that allows you to battle in the underground dungeons of Varanthax’s Maw, deep beneath the Skullpike Mountains – get ready for the Warhammer-iest game of ‘the floor is lava’ ever! The ancient, trap-filled dungeons stretch on and on, populated by monsters and blood-hungry savages, so muster your warbands and prepare to venture into the abyssal darkness…

In addition to everything you need to play – including a core rulebook, dice, terrain, and a double-sided, fold-out card gameboard – the set includes two warbands: the Khainite Shadowstalkers and the Scions of the Flame! The Shadowstalkers are soul-bound to Morathi and imbued with incredible powers that make them a threat unlike any other. After all, it’s hard to escape the Shadowstalkers when they can blink between shadows in an instant and command your own reflection to stab you in the back!

Meanwhile, the Scions of the Flame are Aqshy-obsessed fanatics in service of Archaon, who they believe will scour the Mortal Realms clean in a fiery apocalypse. If Warhammer Age of Sigmar is your jam as well, the box even includes warscrolls for using the new warbands in larger-scale battles too!

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Bardsung
boardgame.description:
You begin with a single tile and a destination. What unfolds is a branching, labyrinthine dungeon of dangerous enemies, wandering monsters, challenging puzzles, and valuable treasure.

Bardsung is a game of choosing your path as you seek to inspire the bard’s songs and live your legend. From your physical passage through the dungeon to your journey of building your character into a fabled hero, your choices define your experience.

Because dungeons are procedurally generated (like those in a roguelike video game), no two playthroughs will be the same. Lay tiles to build the dungeon as you go, choosing your direction from the options at hand to seek loot and avoid threats.

Encounter different enemies and challenges each time through Event, Battle, and Challenge decks that spawn new foes and throw curveballs in the form of poisoned weapons, traps, reinforcements, non-player characters, and more.

Round length, turns, and enemy activations are governed by a dynamic marching order that will keep you on your toes, encouraging you to adopt strategies that control the ebb and flow of initiative.

As you continue your campaign, level up your hero to upgrade their stats, access powerful new abilities, and enhance existing skills. You have the freedom to either follow your hero’s designated path, or to create your own bespoke hero with a unique set of traits and arsenal of attack combos.

Enter intelligent and dangerous combat where positioning and teamwork are vital for maximizing your attacks and working with your allies. Your abilities can’t be used over and over, so choose your moment wisely. And beware, for the same enemy will behave differently from one encounter to the next. Just like your hero, enemies can level up, evolve their attacks, and can even learn to hold grudges against heroes who defeat them...

Bardsung can be enjoyed as a cooperative game of up to five players, or as an exciting solo player experience. Explore the dungeon in standalone sessions, or as part of a far-reaching narrative campaign that evolves based on your decisions.

An RPG dungeon explorer, Bardsung takes the best elements of traditional roleplaying games and beloved dungeon-crawling classics, and combines them with a dash of contemporary gameplay to create a powerful new experience.

With swift setup and easy-to-grasp mechanics taught by an intuitive tutorial-based rulebook, your descent into the dungeon will be quick.

Inspire the songs. Live your legend. Become Bardsung.

boardgame.description:
3 Droid Assistant cards were offered during the original Kickstarter project as stretch goals, each being unlocked one at a time.

After the Kickstarter, the droids are available to buy for an additional $2.

Droids generally help you along the way but with a potential downside if they malfunction! They add an interesting "third character" to any Twin Stars scenario, giving you something else to think about and manage.

The series I droids are:

- C.R.A.N.K.
- MC-CY (Mickey)

The droid assistant cards are "half-sized" cards, measuring at: 2.5" x 1.75" or 63mm x 44mm.

boardgame.name: Twin Stars: SYZYGY Mode II – Waypoint
boardgame.description:
After getting out of debt, you find yourselves on the other side of the universe. In order to get home, you'll have to use waypoints to jump light years in the right direction. However, waypoint access codes are one-time use, and very hard to come by...

In order to do so, you are trekking across the universe, taking on any job that you can, hoping to earn fast credits, and more importantly, make it out alive.

A new Syzygy Mode campaign booklet were offered during the original Kickstarter project as a "Free Expansion".

"Lost in the Galaxy's outer crust, you'll do anything to find your way back home. Guide 3 characters through a series of scenarios that carry over into each other."

Syzygy Mode is a campaign that allows you to play multiple scenarios one after another, in a nice and interconnected way.

boardgame.name: Imagineers: Orange Park Promo Tiles
boardgame.description:
10 new tiles for Imagineers.
Rules:
- Shuffle these tiles in with the others during step B of the game set up.
- During the Move Guests phase, the orange tiles match both yellow Guests and red Guests for scoring purposes.
- The Rainbow Park tile matches all three Guests colors.

boardgame.name: Triathlon: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Triathlon is a game for 3 to 9 players that has more gameplay options than your typical run-based card game. These options include the ability to play Injury Cards on your opponents to slow them down, playing Adrenaline Rush Cards to take a card even when it is not your turn, and, due to the fact that every player has their own discard pile, players are given more options for selecting a card at the beginning of their turn.

The three stages (runs) needed to win the game are:
• Stage One: A run of five cards that can be a mixture of colors and suits
• Stage Two: A run of five cards in a single suit or all the same color
• Stage Three: A run of five cards all being of the same suit and color

To help in accomplishing the stages, Triathlon has three suits; swimmers, cyclists, and runners, and three colors; red, blue, and golden. This gives Triathlon 9 unique sets of cards. Each set has eight cards, 7 numbered cards, and a Pro Card. Pro Cards are wild in number but cannot change their color or suit.

In addition to the cards mentioned above, the deck also contains three Super Pro Cards that are wild in number and color, but cannot change their suit.
-description from designer

boardgame.name: D&D Lair Assault - Dawn of the Forge Titan
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Dungeons & Dragons fifth edition adventure for 5th level characters and group sizes of 4, 5 or 6.

Outside the city of Neverwinter, fiendish cultists conspire to unlock the power of a fiery primordial. Gods help the city if they succeed!

Welcome to the Dungeons & Dragons Lair Assault program! You hold in your hands a module that contains an ultra-challenging encounter designed to be played in a single game session. Odds are the player characters will be annihilated, but that's part of the fun!

In this adventure, the heroes assault a temple complex dedicated to the fire primordial Maegera and come face to face with their own mortality. Only the most clever and canny adventuring party has any hope of survival.

As the DM, not only is it your job to challenge the player characters, but also to kill them outright-all in good fun, of course. (Make sure your players know that!) Don't play favorites or fudge die rolls, however. The encounter is difficult enough that you can let the dice fall where they may.

Here are just a few of the features you'll find in the D&D Lair Assault - Forge of the Dawn Titan (5E) module:

One large battlemap with a unique surprise halfway through the module.
Pre-placed encounters for party sizes of 4, 5 and 6.
Linked room descriptions
Stats for all necessary NPCs converted for D&D fith edition

boardgame.name: D&D Tokens Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

D&D Tokens Volume 1 is a collection of monsters and NPCs from D&D's past that you can use with your modern Dungeons & Dragons game or with any fantasy game on Fantasy Grounds. These tokens were originally featured in the D&D Monster Vault boxed set, but have been presented in a completely new format with just the tokens - all digitally rendered and loaded into a token module for use with Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: D&D Tokens Volume 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

D&D Tokens Volume 2 is a collection of monsters and NPCs from D&D's past that you can use with your modern Dungeons & Dragons game or with any fantasy game on Fantasy Grounds. These tokens were originally featured in the D&D Threats to the Nentir Vale set, but have been presented in a completely new format with just the tokens - each digitally rendered and loaded into a token module for use with Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Unearthed Arcana
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The material in Unearthed Arcana is presented for playtesting and to spark your imagination. These game mechanics are in draft form, usable in your campaign but not refined by final game design and editing. They are not officially part of the game. For these reasons, material in this product is not legal in D&D Adventurers League events.

This Dungeons & Dragons product contains:

Fantasy Grounds automation
Updated with each new article
A detailed reference manual for easy reading.

Note: This product only contains content starting from January 2018 and continues to grow with each new article.

boardgame.name: Greed
boardgame.description:
Greed is played with a standard 52-card deck divided into greed cards (all the courts) and number cards (all others). Each player gets an equal number of greed cards and the number cards are dealt out (with one player getting an extra card in the three-player game).

Players take turns to play one card, which can either go in front of them or in the middle of the table, in either case covering any card previously there. Aces can be played to other players' piles but cannot cover greed cards.

Greed cards can only be played to own's one pile, and in this case the player scores the total of the cards showing on the table (i.e., on top of any of the four or five piles) before placing it. Greed cards and aces are worth zero; all other cards are worth their face value, but positive if black and negative if red. Any other player with a greed card on top of their pile scores the same amount as the active player.

After a player has played a greed card they must play on their own pile next turn to cover it.

boardgame.name: Bolt Action: Campaign – D-Day: British & Canadian Sectors
boardgame.description:
Bolt Action: Campaign – D-Day: British & Canadian Sectors
This campaign book focuses on some of the key clashes fought in Normandy in the summer of 1944 as British, Canadian, Polish, and other Allied forces engaged in desperate battles against a dedicated and determined German opposition. As well as summarising the history, this book also details a number of scenarios inspired by the engagements within the Normandy campaign, and the special rules required to play them.

This book tells the story of the British and Canadian contribution to this monumental task, and the stoic German resistance they faced. It guides Bolt Action players from the latter stages of D-Day, beginning with the fierce fighting in the coastal towns off the beaches at Gold, Juno and Sword, through the violent clashes around the strategically vital city of Caen, and to the march against Germany itself.

Inside, you’ll find thirteen diverse scenarios, covering the action from the first pushes inland, to the dramatic climax of the campaign in the British & Canadian sectors during Operation Tractable.  We’ve also included army lists for four of the campaign’s most important forces – the Canadian Army, the battle-hardened Commandos, the fanatical 12th SS Panzer Division ‘Hitlerjugend’, and the Luftwaffe Field Division. These new army lists add a whole new dimension of play, allowing you to create themed forces for your campaigns in Normandy!

Also included is a whole stable of new special characters, including the VC-winning medic Corporal Frederick Topham, who put life and limb on the line to rescue wounded men, and the fanatical Kurt ‘Panzer’ Meyer, who earned his Iron Cross leading the  Liebstandarte division’s reconnaissance battalion in Russia. These special characters are the perfect opportunity to theme your force further and make for amazing conversion opportunities.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Real Betis Balompié
boardgame.description:
A Monopoly about the Real Betis Balompié, created in 1907.

Play classic Monopoly, but this time being a professional sports manager. Invest in stands and stadiums, rent and spend the money in the official store.

Roll the dice and move around the board thanks to the pawns and travel through the best of the history of Los Verdiblancos - stadiums, best players, and the great victories in team history.

Live the life of a great manager in the fast-paced world of professional sports.
Put yourself in the shoes of a successful Real Betis Balompié manager.
Travel through the best of Betis history: stadiums, the best players and the great victories that made us vibrate with joy.
Invest in stands and stadiums, receive rent and spend the money in the official store.
Be smart and watchful, because there is only room for one at the top. Bankruptcy awaits the rest.
Now, Real Betis fans have the chance to continue enjoying this exclusive official edition of MONOPOLY.

Vive la vida de un gran gestor en el vertiginoso mundo del deporte profesional. Ponte en el lugar de un exitoso manager del Real Betis Balompié.
Viaja por lo mejor de la historia del Betis : estadios, los mejores jugadores y las grandes victorias que nos hicieron vibrar de alegría.
Invierte en gradas y estadios, recibe alquiler y gástate el dinero en la tienda oficial.
Sé astuto y mantente alerta, porque sólo hay sitio para uno en el primer puesto.
A los demás les espera la bancarrota. Ahora, los seguidores del Real Betis tienen la posibilidad de seguir disfrutando con esta exclusiva edición oficial de MONOPOLY.

boardgame.name: Don't Get Got!: Shut Up & Sit Down Special Edition
boardgame.description:
Don’t Get Got is a game of secret missions for 2-10 players, and it takes place while you go about your day. Perfect places to break out

Don’t Get Got would be living with housemates, at work, on holiday, at parties, even at gaming conventions.

Each player gets 6 unique secret missions that involve getting another player to do or say something specific. The first player to complete 3 missions wins.

In this special edition, the team at Shut Up & Sit Down has teamed up with Big Potato Games to create a brand-new edition of with 120 new missions and an aggressively orange colour scheme.

Also included in this Shut Up & Sit Down Special Edition are 10 plastic wallets and 1 collectible sticker.

If you already own Don’t Get Got, this box will work as a very generous expansion, doubling the amount of missions in the base game and letting you play with up to 20 players.

boardgame.name: Medieval Mayhem
boardgame.description:
In Medieval Mayhem, a co-op game for 2-4 players, play the role of 4 heroes: Rogre, Emera, Gallandor, and Kijam as they attempt to rescue all 24 villagers from the dragon Malevol. Actions include moving, rescuing, transferring, and dropping off villagers. Work together and utilize cards from the deck as well as hero effects!

Contents include 24 Meeples, 8 Player Tokens, 4 Hero Cards, 16 Location Cards, 16 Action Cards, and 1 Rulebook.

INTRODUCTION
Malevol, the fabled wicked dragon, has emerged and has his eyes set on villagers. Four brave heroes: Rogre, Emera, Kijam, and Gallandor, must rescue the villagers and drop them off in Farlorn Village. However, if Malevol emerges, and the heroes aren’t on Safe Haven spaces while rescuing villagers, the villagers will die! An orc, a mage, a knight, and an elf must team up to save the villagers from Malevol’s wrath!

OBJECTIVE
Your team must rescue 16 of the 24 villagers. Use action cards and hero effects to help make the objective easier!

GAMEPLAY
Select a player to go first, then play proceeds to the left. A player may perform (3) actions in any order of their choosing. Actions:

Move: Move your token one space vertically or horizontally (diagonal is not allowed). Your piece must move onto a Location Card your first turn and may never leave the game area again.

Transfer: When two players’ tokens occupy the same Location Card, a transfer may occur. You may give one Villager that has been rescued to the other player. Each transfer costs one Action.

Rescue: A player’s token must occupy the same space as the villager being rescued. When moving, be sure to move the villager next to your token.

Drop-Off: When you get to the Village, perform a Drop-Off action to ensure the villager is same from harm.

Each player has one turn each round. After the round ends, reveal a card from the Action Deck. If it is an Action Card, any player may add it to their hand and play it on any of their next turns at no extra action cost. Action cards are discarded after use. However, if it is Malevol, anyone who does not occupy a Safe Haven Location Card will lose 1 villager, then shuffle Malevol back into the Action Card deck. Lost villagers are removed from the game. Each player has an effect that may be used during the game; this does not cost an action to use and can be used any time when applicable. NOTE: Unless otherwise stated, only 1 villager can be rescued per Hero card before drop-off.

GAME END
The game ends when 16 villagers have been rescued and dropped off at the village; in this case, your team wins! The game will also end if 9 villagers die from Malevol; in this case, your team loses.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Meet Me At The Table Games

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Edición Galicia
boardgame.description:
Live the life of an ambitious merchant in the fast-paced world of real estate with this Monopoly Galicia edition.

Discover the essence of Galicia in this amazing edition of Monopoly.

Its capital, Santiago de Compostela, is the final destination for pilgrims on the famous Camino de Santiago. Its landscapes gather lush valleys and impressive beaches. On its coastline, bathed by the Cantabrian Sea and the Atlantic Ocean, there are areas of spectacular cliffs such as those of A Costa da Morte or the incredible National Park of the Atlantic Islands of Galicia.

Play between charming seaside and inland towns and cities such as Santiago de Compostela, A Coruña, Ferrol, Lugo, Orense, Pontevedra or Vigo. Some of its monuments, such as the Tower of Hercules or the Walls of Lugo (both declared World Heritage by UNESCO) will surely leave you impressed.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Edición Cantabria
boardgame.description:
Discover the essence of Cantabria in this amazing edition of Monopoly.

Cantabria has its own edition of the popular Monopoly game, where all the beauty of the region is reflected.

The Cantabrian version of the popular board game is based on the most emblematic places of the entire region and not focused on just one city, reflecting the beauty of Cantabria

The dynamics are the same as ever, only this time, the exciting game of real estate, has in its procurement list, the Cave of Altamira , the Nature Park Cabarceno , the Cave of the Soplao or the Field Golf Abra de Pas. But these are not the only properties that can be bought in the game since Salvé beaches , Oyambre or the Sardinero , share the limelight with some of the most outstanding areas of the region such as the mountain stew or the sobaos and quesadas.

boardgame.name: Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz
boardgame.description:
Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz is a fast, fun and strategic card game for all ages.

Duellerz is rock, paper, scissors....but not as you know it. We've added in special card tiers (Singles, Doubles and Rainbows) plus some game changing cards (Rock N Roll, Steal and Freeze).

It's simple. Each round, players play one card from their hand of five cards, with highest ranked card taking the pile. Rainbows beat Doubles, Doubles beat Singles and Rock N Roll beats them all. Or to mix things up you can play a special Steal card (to steal the highest ranked played card) or Freeze card (to Freeze the round for players to each play another card in the round).

After each round, player pick up to re-stock their hand to five cards. Once all cards from the game pile have been played, players count their win pile.

Win more cards than your opponents to become the Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz champion!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Gingerbreads
Пряники
boardgame.description:
Gingerbreads is a cooperative family game, in which the players will be helping uncle Otto with his order: baking polyominos of gingerbread, coating them with different-colored icing and storing them in the box. If the players fill the box completely before the icing runs out, they win!

During the game the players take turns, going clockwise. On their turn, the player must perform one of the following actions:

• Bake a gingerbread: roll the die — its face will show the gingerbread shape(s) the player will be able to bake during their turn. They choose one shape and take the topmost gingerbread from the corresponding pile for themselves. Each player may have only one gingerbread in front of themselves at a time. The player may also adjust the die result, discard their current gingerbread, or refresh one of the gingerbread piles — but they will have to discard an Icing sphere — the most valuable resource — for that!

• Coat their gingerbread with one Icing sphere: the player chooses 1 of the 9 available Icing spheres from the dispenser that would fit their gingerbread and place it on the corresponding slot of the tile.

• If the player can’t or doesn’t want to do anything of the above, they must discard an Icing sphere from the dispenser.

There are three complexity levels: easy, medium, and hard.
Easy level: No die rolling — the kids bake gingerbreads of any shapes. 

Hard level: Malfunction cards are added — they affect the Icing dispenser and introduce different restrictions for the current turn.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Dice Fishing
boardgame.description:
Dice Fishing is a fast-paced and exciting dice-rolling game that feels a lot like real fishing!

Each round, the players take turns rolling 6 custom Bait dice.

There is a common row of Fish cards that is replenished after each player’s turn. Each card requires a certain set of bait to be placed on it. If all slots of the card are filled, the fish starts biting! The players can guess which of the 7 fish types they are about to catch — zander, trout, perch, pike, sturgeon, salmon, or ide — but they won’t know for sure until they flip the card and see it!

The larger the fish, the harder it is to catch it. Moreover, every fish might get away! In order to increase your chances, you will be mastering your fishing skills by resolving different Opportunity cards that will allow manipulating your rolls and the assortment of fish.

During the game, the players score additional Achievement tokens for different sets of their fish and as soon as anyone collects 7 different fish, they score the endgame Achievement token. After the final scoring, whoever has the most VP wins!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Meenakshi Temple
boardgame.description:
Meenakshi Temple is a three-dimensional worker-placement game in which players will be gradually constructing their own hopurams — breath-taking multi-level gates into Hindu temple.

The players will use a total of 115 custom plastic Deity statues and secure the support of 5 Patron Deities (Meenakshi, Kali, Ganesha, Ganga, and Skanda) while trying to build their hopurams in the most efficient way.

On their turn, the player places their meeple on one of the available action slots and resolves the action. Their choice is based on Hindu astrology: the stronger their action is, the later they will take their turn during the next round. Each round, the stars predict different possibilities and the players will need to adapt.

There are five basic actions in the game: constructing statues, placing a slab that would close the current hopuram’s level, receiving a blessing depending on the statues on the current level, upgrading your sheet, and gaining a wild statue of Shiva.

By the end of the game, all players will have gorgeous constructions consisting of up to 6 levels high in front of them, and whoever scores the most victory points for their hopuram, secret goal and divine blessings wins!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Mini Macaron Madness
boardgame.description:
In Mini Macaroon Madness, your job is to get trays of macaroons out to customers quickly. Mix up flavors and combinations in the right amount to earn favor and become the best macaroon baker.

Game Components
12 Macaroon Tokens
36 Macaroon Tray Cards
8 Dice

Set Up & Quick Play
Shuffle macaroon tokens and macaron tray cards.
Lay out a grid with 4 macarons on both the left and right. Roll the dice and make 4 columns on the top and bottom. Leave space for macaron tray cards to be laid out in a 4x4 grid. Each player receives 4 macaron tray cards.
On your turn, play as many macaron trays into the grid as possible. They need to match one of the two dice options and 1 of the 2 macaron options. Special action cards allow you to add to your turn. Use all 4 cards and receive 4 more. Continue to play until you are unable to play and then restock to 4 cards and end your turn.
When players complete a vertical column, they receive an extra macaron card and roll a die in the column. They may continue their turn.
When players complete a horizontal row, they score 1 point. They change up one of the two macarons and continue their turn. They may score additional points during their turn in that same row if they can place at least one macaron tray. When they are unable to play the row of trays is placed in the discard pile.
Play continues until a player scores 6 points. Keep track of your score on paper.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Helio
boardgame.description:
As a balloon bouquet builder at Helio Balloon shop fill up orders as quickly as you can. Become a Master Balloon Blower at Helio when you reach 20 balloons strings or more in completed balloon bouquets.

Game Components
48 Balloon Tokens
36 Balloon Bouquet String Cards
6 colored dice

Set Up & Quick Play
Shuffle balloon string cards. Deal 4 to each player face up.
Place Balloon tokens in middle of playing area.
Players take turns rolling all 6 dice. Players match dice to cards by number of balloon strings or by color. Some dice may not be matched, set these dice aside as you complete your turn. Players exchange dice matched to cards one at a time for a balloon. If a player fills up the number of strings that card is completed and earns them 1 point per string. Leave one balloon on the card and place it to the right of your playing area. Return remaining balloons to draw pile. Add 1 new card per card filled.
Next player rolls for balloon and play continues.
Play continues until a player reaches 20 balloon strings, on full completed balloon bouquets.
Turns continue until each players has an equal number of turns. All Helio employees count up all their completed bouquet strings. In the case of a tie the player with the most bouquets wins.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: OVALIA: Extension
boardgame.description:
This edition proposes five new suits: Los Pumas / Irish Shamrocks / The Red Dragons / Scottish Thistles / Gli Azzuri to vary your pleasure at OVALIA.

You can either play OVALIA with these 5 new suits; or you can select 1 or more of these new suit and mix with the standard ones to have a deck of 5x16 cards.

OVALIA and OVALIA EXTENSION have the same back, so you can play with the deck of your choice.

boardgame.name: Maeshowe: an Orkney Saga
boardgame.description:
According to the Orkneyinga Saga, Earl Rognvald Kali Kolsson broke into the chambered tomb of Maeshowe, on Orkney, in AD 1150. In AD 1153, Earl Harald Maddadson and a group of his men sheltered there during a snowstorm. The sagas tell us that Rognvald found treasure there and that two of Harald’s men went mad.

Alone or with a friend, players will on their turn need to play one card to the row and discard one. Managing their hand of five cards players need to make tough calls on what to play while carefully managing their resources of health, food and cards left in their draw deck.

The players will free themselves from the Tomb of Maeshowe once they've removed enough rubble blocking their escape. By playing a set of four "Excavation" cards to the row, the players are able to remove rubble. The timing of when to start a set of "Excavation" cards will be critical since a row of less than four will result in those cards being lost decreasing player chance for survival.

If the player ever find themselves having zero health or having run out of cards in their draw deck, they have lost and their dead bodies will be found in the Tomb of Maeshowe by archeologists hundreds of years later.

Other threats presented by their draw deck includes such things as the passage collapsing and running out of food while some well-needed sleep or Odin himself sending a Raven to watch over you can provide you with some much-needed relief.

This updated version of Lee Broderick's Print and Play game Maeshowe offers a streamlined version of the core gameplay while adding a series of mini-expansions and alternate set-ups for more variety, challenge, and replay-ability.

boardgame.name: Dice Throne: Saison 1 Remasterisée – Barbare vs Elfe Lunaire
Dice Throne: Season One ReRolled – Barbar v. Mondelfe
Dice Throne: Season One ReRolled – Barbarian v. Moon Elf
Dice Throne: Starcie 1 – Barbarzyńca vs Księżycowa Elfka
Трон кубов. Варвар vs Лунная эльфийка
boardgame.description:
Dice Throne Season One ReRolled is a remastered edition of Dice Throne: Season One

Dice Throne is a game of intriguing dice, tactical card play, powerful heroes, and unique abilities.

It's a fast-paced 2-6 player combat game (1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all). Select from a variety of heroes that play and feel completely distinct from one another. Attack opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).

The Barbarian isn't the most elegant hero around. He loves to smash things. He is known for hitting opponents so hard, they are left stunned and concussed. His endless barrage of heavy-hitting attacks shows that even the most simple fighting style can be deadly.

The Moon Elf draws her energy from the light of the moon. Her exploding arrows can pierce even the toughest of armor when loosed from her giant long bow. Her quick and nimble stature makes her extremely hard to hit, as she picks off her targeted foes from the vale of the forest.

Contents:
2 Hero Boards
2 Hero Leaflets
2 Health Dials
2 Combat Points Dials
2 Hero Decks
10 Dice
Tokens
Rulebook
Gametrayz Inserts

boardgame.name: Dice Throne: Saison 1 Remasterisée – Moine vs Paladin
Dice Throne: Season One ReRolled – Kampfmönch v. Paladin
Dice Throne: Season One ReRolled – Monk v. Paladin
Dice Throne: Starcie 2 – Mnich vs Paladyn
Трон кубов. Монах vs Паладин
boardgame.description:
Dice Throne Season One ReRolled is a remastered edition of Dice Throne: Season One

Dice Throne is a game of intriguing dice, tactical card play, powerful heroes, and unique abilities.

It's a fast-paced 2-6 player combat game (1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all). Select from a variety of heroes that play and feel completely distinct from one another. Attack opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).

The Monk is a master in the art of Chi. He can channel his ancient energy to absorb incoming attacks from his opponents. He can also use it to unleash a maelstrom of pain. The Monk is not only the calm before the storm, but the storm itself.

The Paladin's sword of righteousness strikes hard and true. Through faithful devotion, he's capable of celestial defense. The Paladin wades into battle assured that the Divine is with him, and that victory is his sovereign right.

Contents:
2 Hero Boards
2 Hero Leaflets
2 Health Dials
2 Combat Points Dials
2 Hero Decks
10 Dice
Tokens
Rulebook
Gametrayz Inserts

boardgame.description:
Dice Throne Season One ReRolled is a remastered edition of Dice Throne: Season One

Dice Throne is a game of intriguing dice, tactical card play, powerful heroes, and unique abilities.

It's a fast-paced 2-6 player combat game (1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all). Select from a variety of heroes that play and feel completely distinct from one another. Attack opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).

The Pyromancer has only way to deal with her enemies: swift, hot destruction. Even her defense is offensive. She is a glass cannon who deals massive amounts of damage, turning her foes to ash.

The Shadow Thief doesn't like to end things quickly, much preferring the long con. Gaining CP, poisoning his foes, hiding and striking from the shadows - that is the way of the Shadow Thief, and if their complicated game plans are allowed to reach fruition, victims will find themselves in utter ruin.

boardgame.name: Fjords
boardgame.description:
Explore a landscape so stunning that even a Viking would hold their breath in awe...

Fjords is a tile-laying game that takes place in two phases. The first one invites the players to explore the fjords around them by laying hexagonal landscape tiles, creating a map that serves as the gameboard. In the second phase, players begin from the longhouses they placed during phase one and will walk the landscape, claiming as much of the plains and cliffs as possible.

The winner of the game will be the player who has claimed the most land. Savvy placements and the ability to plan ahead yet act tactically will be your most important tools.

This new edition of Fjords differs from the original release in the following ways:


The game now plays up to four players.
The game contains five new variants/modules designed by Phil Walker-Harding. These add optional variety and flavor to the game.


-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Silicon Valley
boardgame.description:
Scott Almes' Silicon Valley puts players in the shoes of budding entrepreneurs struggling to be the first amongst their competitors to have their startup company valued at $1 billion.

Players hire staff for their start-up company to put out new products, with the nature of the products being determined by patterns that you build with polyominoes. By putting these products on the market, you gain income, but other players might copy your product and take some of that money for themselves — refining your ideas to steal market share, as it were. Along the way you need to acquire funding, hire and fire staff, seek investors, expand your HQ, and try not to go bankrupt while working you way toward being the first company to be valued at $1 billion, which nets you the win.

Silicon Valley plays in 60-90 minutes and includes a challenging and innovative solo-mode.

boardgame.name: Yellow & Yangtze: The Royal Palace
boardgame.description:
Yellow & Yangtze: The Royal Palace is an expansion for Yellow & Yangtze that consists of three modules that can be added to the base game separately or together:


A new game board with 18 starting capitals on it.
Rogue bandits, which add non-player-controlled fighters to the board that must be overcome.
The royal palace, a larger building that must be built upon four tiles of the same color and that gives its controlling player a special benefit.

boardgame.name: Kinswinds
boardgame.description:
Kinswinds is born of a desire for a deception game that focused more on information control and less on guesswork and odds.

The game attempts to simulate the power of suggestion, encouraging players to invest in the strongest card suits but also encouraging attempts to influence which suits other players believe​ are the strongest, not only through bluffing but also through actions.

Players move together through 5 steps whilst passing, discarding and activating card abilities, all of this giving them several options for altering the distribution of the cards and thus the score value of those cards. Players choose which cards they will score on during the game and in the fifth step can take a small points penalty to force the game to end if they think their chosen cards are worth the most.

At this point all hands are revealed, each player's chosen score cards are revealed and their value is calculated, the highest scoring player being declared the winner.

The game takes seconds to get running and comes in a pocket sized deckbox.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Gardens
boardgame.description:
Sydney's Royal Botanic Garden holds a special place in the hearts of locals. World renowned for its location, beauty, and historical and scientific significance, each of its 29 hectares are not only stunning, but a calming retreat from the city's streets.

In The Gardens, players draft cards depicting different features of the Gardens, using them to build their own portion of it in front of themselves. Players then score points based on what their visitors see as they walk past the Gardens' various flower beds, ponds, native trees, and statues. The tableau you build will have three rows — waterside, grass, and cityside — and you add one card a turn until the area is filled.

The game is accessible and simple to learn, yet offers strategic choices. Its included modules add variability and depth for experienced players, with landmarks such as the Opera House and Harbour Bridge that players can gain for extra points or special abilities, so join the picnickers, joggers, lorikeets, and bin chickens, and enjoy your day in the beautiful Botanic gardens.

-description from publisher
